page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: The natural beauty of the two lakes, once gravel pits,now provide a haven for plants,animals and birds.Reeds and rushes are good nesting sites,and the fields have rabbits,insects and other wildlife.Swifts fly round and we saw a robin on a bush.We also saw pigeons, great tits,red admirals, small green beetles and a thrush with a spotted, bright white tummy.Through binoculars we saw a swan with a dirty neck and orange and black beak.We also saw a Spotted Grebe.There is one pair of breeding swans on each lake.Coots breed on the lakes as well as ducks. It is a beautiful,peaceful spot,which the villagers cherish.Fishing rights belong to the Kelvedon Club and the lakes are well stocked with carp, perch,tench,pike,roach,rudd and bream.
